acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 96-hour LC50 = 403 mg/L for fish (fathead minnow) (ECOTOX, 2008), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 of 270 mg/kg obtained in dermal administration tests using rabbits (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It is documented that exposure to 8000 ppm for 2 hours (4-hour conversion: 16000 ppm or 61 mg/L) was found to be LC100 (3/3 dead) for rats (HSDB (2002)). However, classification is not possible due to insufficient data available. Given that its saturated vapour pressure concentration was 7632 ppm (29 mg/L), the substance was in a mist state in the experiment.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Although its rat LCLo value is documented to be 1000 ppm/4h (PATTY (5th, 2001), a LC50 value is not provided. In a different study, although a mouse LC50 is found to be 4 mg/L (1052 ppm) (RTECS (1998)), exposure duration is not provided. Thus, classification is not possible due to insufficient data available. Since its saturated vapour pressure concentration is 7632 ppm (29 mg/L), the study was conducted presumably in a vapour state with almost no included mists.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The LD50 values of 800 mg/kg and 1290 mg/kg, obtained in oral administration tests using rats (HSDB (2002)), fall under Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it is water soluble (water solubility = 1000000 mg/L (SRC, 2005), and its categorization for acute toxicity is "Not classified", the substance was classified into "Not classified".

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Its flash point of 39degC (GESTIS (accessed in October 2008)) falls under Category 3.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible due to lack of information such as in vivo mutagenicity test data and positive results in in vitro mutagenicity tests using several indices. Also, chromosomal aberration tests using human lymphocytes gave positive results (HSDB (2002)) while gene mutation tests using cultured V79 cells gave negative results (NTP DB (accessed in October 2008)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its autoignition point of 500degC (Ullmanns (E) (6th, 2003)), which id above 70degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Rabbit tests found that the substance is severely irritating (PATTY (5th, 2001); HSDB (2002)). Based on this document, the substance was classified into Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In rabbit tests, three types of isomers were found to be moderately to severely irritating, and 4-picoline was reported to cause most severe irritation (PATTY (5th, 2001); HSDB (2002)). Based on these documents, the substance was classified into Category 2.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the effects of long-term exposure to the substance in humans include occasional diarrhea, weight loss, anemia, and ocular and facial paralysis (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 1 (nervous system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Symptoms resulting from acute exposure to the substance in humans include headache, vomiting, giddiness, and narcotic effects (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Based on this description, the substance was classified into Category 3 (narcotic effects).
